definition: letter/mail/CL:封[feng1]/to trust/to believe/to profess faith in/truthful/confidence/trust/at will/at random

sentences.english: And David said unto the young man that told him, Whence art thou?
sentences.chinese: 大卫问报信的少年人说，你是哪里的人。

sentences.english: The intelligence information work is in the guiding position in the whole public security work.
sentences.chinese: 情报信息工作在整个公安工作中居于先导地位。

sentences.english: Informs the correspondence is to guarantee falls the transmission to approve notifies the number and the information information.
sentences.chinese: 报知通信是为了保降传递赞报信号和情报信息。

sentences.english: Information is the promise and base of investigation and decision .
sentences.chinese: 情报信息是侦查决策的前提和基础。

sentences.english: The development of enterprises can't do without the support of information.
sentences.chinese: 企业的发展离不开情报信息的支持。

sentences.english: He is ordering steps to improve airport security and the handling of intelligence information.
sentences.chinese: 他正在调整改善机场安全的步骤并处理情报信息。

sentences.english: Just don't forget to carefully trim the tip off each claw before applying the nail cap.
sentences.chinese: 只是不要忘记仔细修剪爪通风报信每个申请前钉帽。

sentences.english: The source of fear, from this so-called "letter to report."
sentences.chinese: 恐惧的源头，来自这封所谓的“举报信”。

sentences.english: Whenever news comes out, you must send messages to me to keep me informed.
sentences.chinese: 如果有什么消息出来，你一定要先给我通风报信。

sentences.english: And he called the porters； and they told it to the king's house within.
sentences.chinese: 守城门的叫了众守门的人来，他们就进去与王家报信。

sentences.english: See, I will tarry in the plain of the wilderness, until there come word from you to certify me.
sentences.chinese: 我在旷野的渡口那里等你们报信给我。

sentences.english: Someone tipped off the police that the thief was hiding in the garage.
sentences.chinese: 有人向警察通风报信，举报有窃贼隐藏在车库里面。

sentences.english: And there came a messenger unto Job, and said, The oxen were plowing, and the asses feeding beside them
sentences.chinese: 有报信的来见约伯，说，牛正耕地，驴在旁边吃草。

sentences.english: Acrobatics undertake Bridge of exchange of culture messenger.
sentences.chinese: 杂技从事文化报信者的交换桥。

sentences.english: Jan tipped me off that the boss is going to make an inspection tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 简向我通风报信说老板明天要来检查。

sentences.english: AHu and ox horn came near, devil news, everyone early preparation.
sentences.chinese: 阿虎和牛角赶来报信，鬼子临近，大家早做准备。

definition: to send word/to deliver a letter
to pass on a story/to communicate a message
to report on completion of a mission/debriefing
intelligence gatherer/spy/detective/scout/sound (medical instrument)/long and narrow probing and sampling utensil
to take a letter/to send word
to report back to one's superior
